alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 12 at 3:58AM PST until January 13 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow amounts are no longer expected to reach advisory amounts. Therefore the Winter Weather Advisory has been cancelled. However, there may still be 1 to 2 inches in southern areas along the base of the Blue Mountains, such as in Pilot Rock. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow is no longer expected as the weather system bringing that snow is now expected to track to far to the south. Therefore the Winter Storm Watch is cancelled. * WHERE...Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. * WHEN...From this afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon
